intro: Consolida stocksiana, commonly known as the Stocks flower or winter stock, is a flowering plant in the family Papaveraceae. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia and is characterized by its showy, fragrant, yellow or orange flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has simple, alternate leaves that are lance-shaped. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often blooming from late winter to early summer. The flowers are rich in nectar and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
